org.unc.lac.javapetriconcurrencymonitor.utils

Class PriorityBinaryLock

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.unc.lac.javapetriconcurrencymonitor.utils.PriorityBinaryLock

  • public class PriorityBinaryLock
extends java.lang.Object
    A lock with two priority levels. There is only one permit available, thus the 'binary' in the class' name. Each lock() blocks if necessary until the lock is available, and then takes it. Each unlock() releases the lock, potentially waking a blocking acquirer. The special feature in this lock is that a lock(LockPriority) call may be with high or low priority, and a unlock() call prioritizes a high priority caller. That is, a thread sleeping with high priority will be released before a low priority one. Among threads of the same priority level, the lock's queue behaves as a FIFO queue.
    See Also:
    PriorityBinaryLock.LockPriority

    • Constructor Detail

      • PriorityBinaryLock

        public PriorityBinaryLock()

    • Method Detail

      • lock

        public void lock()
        Tries to lock this PriorityLock with low priority. Takes the lock if available and returns immediately, else the current thread becomes disabled for thread scheduling purposes and lies dormant until some other thread invokes the unlock() method for this lock and the current thread is next in line.

      • lock

        public void lock(PriorityBinaryLock.LockPriority priority)
        Tries to lock this PriorityLock with the specified priority. Takes the lock if available and returns immediately, else the current thread becomes disabled for thread scheduling purposes and lies dormant until some other thread invokes the unlock() method for this lock and the current thread is next in line.

      • unlock

        public void unlock()
        Releases this lock. If there's any thread waiting for it, wake it up. Which thread is to be woken is queue's responsibility.

      • getLowPriorityQueueLength

        public long getLowPriorityQueueLength()
        Returns the length of the low priority queue
        Returns:
        the number of threads waiting for this lock with low priority

      • getHighPriorityQueueLength

        public long getHighPriorityQueueLength()
        Returns the length of the high priority queue
        Returns:
        the number of threads waiting for this lock with high priority

      • isLocked

        public boolean isLocked()
        Tests the lock and informs if it's taken
        Returns:
        True if the lock is taken

      • hasQueuedThreads

        public boolean hasQueuedThreads()
        Returns:
        True if there are threads waiting to take this lock
